'''NGOL''' is an [[Elvish]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "knowledge, wisdom, lore".<ref name=WJC>{{WJ|C}}, p. 383</ref>

==Derivatives==

*[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''ñgolodō'' ("the Wise")<ref name=WJC/> or ''ngolodō''<ref name=P4k>{{MR|P4k}}, p. 350</ref>
**[[Quenya]]: ''[[Noldor|Ñoldo]]'',<ref name=WJC/> ''noldo''<ref name=P4k/>
**[[Telerin]]: ''Goldo''<ref name=WJC/>
**[[Sindarin]]: ''[[Golodh]] (Ngolodh)''<ref name=WJC/>

*[[Quenya]]: ''ñolé'' ("long study (of any subject)")<ref name=WJC/> or ''ñólë'' ("lore, knowledge");<ref name=P4k/> ''iñgole'' ("lore");<ref name=WJC/> ''ingolmo'' ("loremaster")<ref name=WJC/>
**[[Telerin]]: ''góle, engole''
**[[Sindarin]]: ''[[gûl]]''
**[[Black Speech]]: ''[[gûl]]''

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the [[The Etymologies|''Etymologies'']] appears the roots ÑGOL, signifying "wise, wisdom, be wise", and ÑGOLOD, signifying "one of the wise folk, Gnome".<ref name=Ety377>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 377. Cf., {{VT|46a}}, p. 3</ref>
